page.title: 06ROADS SERVING CRANAGE
page.content: Cranage has always had major roads linking it with other towns. The A50 used to be the main link to the south and north to Manchester whilst the A54 was the main Chester Buxton road. With the opening of the M6 in November 1963 much of the traffic was diverted from these roads. Our school log book says: "The M6 motorway was opened on Friday last and the school has to-day enjoyed for the first time the benefits of the great decrease in the volume of traffic on the A50 road". There is still a lot of traffic, mainly cars, passing our school, but very little compared to the traffic using the motorway. Before the M6 was opened all the heavy lorries, coaches and delivery vans had to pass our school, so it would have been very noisy.
